fr_reason: The first patent (US9257711B2) aims to improve energy production efficiency in molten carbonate fuel cells, whereas the second patent (US11955674B1) focuses on reducing carbon dioxide emissions during hydrocarbon cracking systems. The functional purpose of US9257711B2 directly impacts the efficiency and production of energy from the fuel cell.
fr_ours: Improves energy production efficiency in molten carbonate fuel cells by adjusting hydrogen utilization beyond the traditional 70% to 75%.
fr_competitor: Reduces carbon dioxide emissions in hydrocarbon cracking systems during olefin production by converting methane into electricity.
tu_reason: The technical uniqueness of US9257711B2 lies in its ability to recycle excess hydrogen from anode exit to anode inlet, enhancing efficiency with a range of over 10% to 30%. In contrast, the second patent (US11955674B1) simply separates and utilizes methane as an energy source for electricity production, which is not as distinctive.
tu_ours: Enhances efficiency through recycling excess hydrogen from anode exit to anode inlet, with a range of over 10% to 30%.
tu_competitor: Converts methane into electricity using a fuel cell, separating the first cracking product stream and utilizing the methane as an energy source
sv_reason: Both patents have high strategic value. The first patent (US9257711B2) increases energy production and promotes more efficient use of hydrogen, while the second patent (US11955674B1) offers a lower carbon footprint for hydrocarbon cracking systems, contributing to environmental regulations compliance.
sv_ours: Increases energy production and promotes more efficient use of hydrogen.
sv_competitor: Offers lower carbon footprint for hydrocarbon cracking systems, contributing to environmental regulations compliance
overall_reason: The first patent has a more distinctive functional purpose and technical uniqueness, although both patents have high strategic value.

sv_competitor: Allows compliance with current and future emission standards, reduces hazardous separation costs, and provides high-purity H2 for various applications
overall_reason: The EP4469183A1 patent offers broader strategic value, addressing both environmental compliance and product quality, while the US9257711B2 patent focuses primarily on energy production efficiency.

fr_reason: The CN114909388B patent focuses on enhancing the durability of flexible screens during the folding process, whereas the US11703916B2 patent aims to ensure stability of moving tracks. fr_ours: Ensures stability of moving tracks in foldable electronic devices during folding or unfolding processes by preventing shaking

tu_reason: The CN114909388B patent employs a unique hinge mechanism with four swing arms that allows controlled bending motion, whereas the US11703916B2 patent uses a symmetrically disposed linkage system. tu_ours: Uses a symmetrically disposed linkage system with sliding joint structures to absorb forces and maintain stability
tu_competitor: Employs a hinge mechanism with four swing arms that allow limited rotation and sliding movement for housing bases, enabling controlled bending motion
sv_reason: Although both patents contribute to market competitiveness by offering improved product durability, the US11703916B2 patent's focus on reducing wear and tear during folding or unfolding processes directly enhances the overall quality of foldable electronic devices.
sv_ours: Enhances durability and product quality of foldable electronic devices by reducing wear and tear during folding or unfolding processes
sv_competitor: Extends service life of foldable devices, contributing to market competitiveness by offering improved product durability
overall_reason: The CN114909388B patent provides more comprehensive durability improvements for foldable electronic devices.
